text: Antiscopa acompa is a moth in the family Crambidae. It was described by Edward Meyrick in 1884 from specimens obtained near Lake Wakatipu at 1,200 feet. It is endemic to New Zealand. The wingspan is 17.5–19 mm. The forewings are ochreous-fuscous, at the base irrorated with dark fuscous. There are whitish lines. The hindwings are whitish grey, with a darker grey lunule, postmedial line and submarginal line. Adults have been recorded on wing in December. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1884 Category:Scopariinae Category:Endemic fauna of New Zealand Category:Moths of New Zealand Category:Taxa named by Edward Meyrick
title: Antiscopa acompa
